name: SelectRoot
description:
Groups all parts of the select.
Doesn’t render its own HTML element.

name.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.

defaultValue.description:
The uncontrolled value of the select when it’s initially rendered.

To render a controlled select, use the `value` prop instead.

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when the value of the select changes. Use when controlled.

defaultOpen.description:
Whether the select menu is initially open.

To render a controlled select menu, use the `open` prop instead.

open.description: Whether the select menu is currently open.

onOpenChange.description: Event handler called when the select menu is opened or closed.

alignItemToTrigger.description: Determines if the selected item inside the popup should align to the trigger element.

onOpenChangeComplete.description: Event handler called after any animations complete when the select menu is opened or closed.

trap.description:
How the select should trap focus, scroll, and pointer outside presses.
- `none`: don't trap any interactions.
- `scroll-pointer`: trap scroll and pointer outside presses.

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

readOnly.description: Whether the user should be unable to choose a different option from the select menu.

required.description: Whether the user must choose a value before submitting a form.
